title: mirek92
author: mirek92
content: Hello, I would like which blockchain is in your opinion the best for usage in real life?ETH/BSC/Cronos/Polygon/Kucoin/Avalanche/Fantomhttps://ibb.co/WnhSgjREthereum has unacceptable fees for most of people,BNB smart chain has bellow 1 usd.Other five blockchain has trasnaction fees less than 0,1 usd. Which of them would you choose to create token for real usage?Thank you

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: It depends on what kind of real-life usage. Specifically, about practicality, although as far as I'm aware those coins mentioned are using EVM, some coins may offer better options than the others depending on the use case. But still, "real usage" is too wide to be specifically answered. Also, the target market you choose plays an essential part in order to decide which cryptocurrencies that suit your needs.

comments.author: mirek92
comments.body: I mean for example classic shopping in store or paying in restaurant and so on. For these examples people would probably require fast transactions and negligible amount of fees. Is there anything else important for that?

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: Quote from: mirek92 on May 29, 2022, 03:45:13 PMHello, I would like which blockchain is in your opinion the best for usage in real life?I can't pick which one from them in your list that will be very useful in your real life but i just remind you that being scalable was a must to make sure if people can use it as their daily payment system. In this case i think that only those blockchains with good scalability that can be used in our real life. People will be using coin to buy something and used it in their life. Remember that crypto was about the economic. This means the value of crypto is really helping for people to use it for some purposes.

comments.author: Flexystar
comments.body: Avalanche is funded by university donations and is really picking pace in the field. They do have amazing competition against ETH chain and I think runs over other chains too. Founded by professor it has favourable fees, faster transactions and yet being developed to go ahead of ETH. The donations or investments are nicely pulling towards it so that must be good enough to understand this chain could be helpful. Whether itâ€™s your real life usage or on chain usage the fact remains same in terms of its fees and faster transactions.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: @mirek92, In my personal opinion, the blockchain network that is suitable for use in real life is a blockchain that has a high transaction speed (we know it as TPS), although the blockchain network is not completely decentralized, but as long as the transaction execution is fast, it is very suitable for use in real life. Just imagine if you use the Ethereum network? It will take a very long time to execute the transaction."Real life need scalability and speed, not decentralization."

comments.author: MFahad
comments.body: Fee is not only one factor people look for.any Blockchain project has very low fee but they have some another issues like lack of partnership and securities and failed to get the attention of projects. Etherium fee is high but still top Blockchain along with many top projects using this. Bnb is also safest Blockchain with low fee. All other Blockchain has not proved yet the real Usecase

For these examples people would probably require fast transactions and negligible amount of fees. Is there anything else important for that?Sure things, most people won't spend extensive fees when they pay in-store especially if they are doing small transactions. Or waiting for the transaction gets confirmed or settled when they are done with it.Quote from: mirek92 on May 30, 2022, 03:08:45 PMIs there anything else important for that?Of course, it depends on the factor of the ecosystem adoption within the place. Surely you shouldn't use a cryptocurrency that lacks a userbase. We can argue that using ETH and BNB sounds like a probable option since both coins have better adoption compared to others, but if we include tx fees, Polygon or Ava also sounds nice.
